text: The Bowls England National Championships (Men's Fours) is one of the events at the annual Bowls England National Championships. ==History== The event was called the Charles Wood Australian Cup in its early days. During the 1908 final, the skip of the Upper Clapton team Mr H Grounds collapsed and died during play. The title was awarded to Carlisle Edenside. ==Past Winners== {|class="sortable wikitable" |- !width="30"|Year !width="110"|County !width="400"|Champions !width="110"|County !width="400"|Runners-up !width="60" class="unsortable"|Score |- | align=center|1905|| Cumberland || Unknown (Carlisle Subscription) || Middlesex || Unknown (Bounds Green) || by 17 points |- | align=center|1906|| Northumberland || Unknown (Newcastle West End) || Middlesex || Unknown (Upper Clapton) || 24-10 |- | align=center|1907|| Cumberland || Johnson (Carlisle West End) || Kent || Stewart (Forest Hill) || 21-18 |- | align=center|1908|| Cumberland || A.
